page.title: 13LUDLOW ADVERTIZER
page.content: Ludlow's weekly newspaper the Ludlow Advertizer was founded in 1855 by a man called John Crosse.The earliest copy in the British Museum is that of August 28th 1869. It was published and printed in various places around Ludlow until it moved to its present building in 1932.In 1960 the printing of the paper was moved to Stourbridge and in 1984 moved to Worcester. The ownership of the paper passed to the Berrows group in 1971 and since then has become part of the Reed International Group. Ludlow Advertizer offices are still in Upper Galdeford and the present editor Vince Bufton and 3 staff reporters work there.It is published on Tuesdays and comes out every Wednesday, price 18pence.
